meanings.definition: Staring with wide-open eyes in amazement or wonder.
meanings.sent1: The children were agazed at the colorful fireworks in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: She looked agazed at the beautiful sunset over the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The puppy sat agazed at the spinning ceiling fan, utterly fascinated.
meanings.sent4: The audience sat agazed as the magician performed his incredible tricks.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's agazed expression when she saw the unicorn was priceless.

meanings.sent1: The detective agazed at the mysterious clue, trying to solve the case.
meanings.sent2: He agazed at the stars, lost in the vastness of the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat agazed at the moving laser pointer, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent4: She agazed at the painting, trying to decipher its hidden meaning.
meanings.sent5: The old man agazed at the photo, reminiscing about his youth.
